intro: Licania gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's licinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
